Below are concise, consistent hashtag tag-sets for each event in your Knowledge Base chronology. Each event is given the original event name (and date when present) followed by a compact list of recommended tags. Tags include (a) the most relevant of the 12 category tags you asked to use and (b) event-specific hashtags (e.g., legislation names, people, programs, evidence types). Use these to filter by category or search term.

Legend: primary category tags drawn from your 12 categories (e.g., #LegislationPolicy, #CongressionalHearings, #LeaksDeclass, #WhistleblowerDisclosures, #MilitaryEncounters, #CivilianSightings, #AbductionCEIII, #CrashRetrievals, #UnderwaterUSO, #SpaceSatellite, #ScientificStudies, #HistoricalPreModern, #ReligiousCultural). I also reuse your earlier sample hashtags (e.g., #UAPLegislation, #UAPHearing, #FOIARelease, #AARO, #UAPRecordsCollection) where appropriate.

Notes on using tags:
- Always include at least one of the 12 category tags for filtering (e.g., #LegislationPolicy, #CongressionalHearings, #LeaksDeclass, #WhistleblowerDisclosures, #MilitaryEncounters, #CivilianSightings, #AbductionCEIII, #CrashRetrievals, #UnderwaterUSO, #SpaceSatellite, #ScientificStudies, #HistoricalPreModern, #ReligiousCultural).
- Add 1–3 event-specific tags for precision (#AARO, #UAPDA, #Grusch, #Elizondo, #KonaBlue, #NARA, #NRO, #JWST, #LLNL, #NDAA, #MOSULORB etc.).
- For contested or dubious items (e.g., dubious leaks, LARP claims, conspiracy-heavy claims), add a caution tag when you import into systems: #Contested #Debunked? #Allegation.
- For cross-domain events (e.g., UAP near nuclear sites), include both #MilitaryEncounters and #NuclearSite or #CriticalInfrastructure.

If you want, I can:
- Export this as a CSV (event / date / category-tag(s) / event-tags) for import into Agentic or a database.
- Produce the same tag mapping but limited to only government/official events, or only whistleblower/leak items.
- Add “confidence” or “flag” fields (e.g., Verified / Unverified / Debated) for each event.

Which output would you like next (CSV, JSON, or smaller batches by decade)?
